body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @mallenexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761161182007609) ## Action Performed: 1. Open a 1:1 chat with another user 2. Press Cmd + K (Quick Search) 3. Observe the search options displayed ## Expected Result: The top option should be “Search in [current chat user]” to allow quick in-thread search. ## Actual Result: Recent searches are shown first, and “Search in [current chat user]” does not appear as the top option, reducing usability. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: Updates to "Contact method" section of New Expensify profile

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1759324105084269?thread_ts=1754324642.498629&cid=C07HPDRELLD), we'd like to improve how we surface and promote the functionality and benefits of having multiple contact methods in New Expensify. The screenshots below call out how we want the finished product to look. ## Details In New Expensify, under **Account > Profile > Public > Contact method**, here are the **two** changes we'd like to make: - [ ] Update from `Contact method` to `Contact methods` so it's clear you can add multiple - [ ] Ensure the field itself can support multiple contact methods (email and phone) in a list, if multiple have been added Clicking a layer deeper into the `Contact methods` screen, here are the **three** changes we'd like to make: - [ ] Update the copy at the top to: > Add more ways to log in and send receipts to Expensify. > > Add an email address to forward receipts to receipts@expensify.com, or add a phone number to text receipts to 47777 (US numbers only). - [ ] Above each contact method, include a new `Primary` or `Secondary` label - [ ] Remove the current copy below the primary contact method, which reads: > Whenever we need to get in touch with you, we'll use this contact method. **[Figma link](https://www.figma.com/design/MLeWGyEkyC5s3MoBhmuIMr/Contact-Methods-Improvements?node-id=40-9395&p=f&t=0g4XgUScyE2bvc86-11)** cc @Expensify/design for viz
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @MonilBhavsar

___

**Version Number:** v9.2.34-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** y
**Reproducible in production?:** y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @twisterdotcom 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05S5EV2JTX/p1760251072024579

## Action Performed:
1. Open a travel expense
2. Click the receipt
3. Click "View Trip" in the top right

## Expected Result:
The user should have been brought to the trip booking with details

## Actual Result:
Nothing happens

## Workaround:
The user can manually go to the trip room

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.36-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176910/test-cases/41237484 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 18.5 Safari **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: User has two workspaces (one is default) and some chats with other accounts 1. Navigate to the Account/ Preferences and change priority mode to #focus 2. Sign out and sign in again 3. Click on FAB - Create expense - Manual, enter the amount 4. Click on the "To" row to open the recipients options ## Expected Result: All the existing workspaces and contacts appear on the "Choose recipient" RHP ## Actual Result: Only default workspace (and self DM, is applicable) appears on the "Choose recipient" RHP, when re-login while the account is in the #focus priority mode ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9adeb99-4496-4efb-830d-3c181e8b5a90 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Android - Expense - Empty space instead of keyboard if backgrounding app while creating expense

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.36-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1424/folder/13177029/41237792/965872108 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1942@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any chat. 3. Start manual expense creation flow. 4. Add any amount and tap on "Next" 5. Open any field to edit. (For example: Merchant) 6. Open keyboard if it is not opened yet. 7. With keyboard still opened, background and reopen app. 8. Note that keyboard is closed, but empty space is displayed below "Save" button. (If this step does not reproduce on first try, repeat step 7 one more time) 9. Tap on the arrow on the top left corner. 10. Note that empty space is also visible on details page, below "Create" button. 11. Tap on the back button on top left corner again, until returning to chat. 12. Note that the same empty space is visible below composer. 13. Tap on composer. 14. Note that keyboard reappears and empty space disappears. ## Expected Result: After backgrounding and reopening app with keyboard opened during expense creation flow, keyboard should close and no empty space should be created on the bottom of the page. ## Actual Result: After backgrounding and reopening app with keyboard opened while editing expense fields during creation, an empty space remains displayed instead of keyboard. This empty space is also visible when returning to previous sections and chat. Issue only stops reproducing after tapping on composer or text input, to reopen keyboard manually. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/42e9dadf-7a95-4ce2-ab8b-ea236e0e2239 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
